feature1.explanation: Text 1 uses commas and periods for punctuation, while Text 2 also uses commas and periods but adds dashes for additional information. They both have a similar style in using punctuation.

feature2.explanation: Both texts demonstrate an informal tone and lexical choices. The word choice and sentence structures are relatively similar, with a mix of longer and shorter sentences.

feature3.explanation: Text 1 and Text 2 both contain a mix of sentence lengths and structures. They exhibit coherence and cohesion in presenting information.

feature4.explanation: Both texts have a narrative style discussing personal experiences. They share a similar tone of reflection on past events.

feature5.explanation: No spelling or typographical errors were found in either text.

overall.explanation: Considering the similarities in punctuation style, lexical and grammatical features, sentence structure, text and discourse features, as well as the absence of spelling errors, there is a moderate to high likelihood that the two texts were written by the same author.
